result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Brian Buelow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total fines and costs in the amount of $642.00 to be payed by payment plan of $50 per month commencing on August 1st, 2016 and to be payed on the first of the month each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment being entered for the amount of the remaining balance.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample to the Ozaukee County Sheriff's Department.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Austin Brian Buelow in court with attorney Perry P Lieuallen.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Atty Lieuallen's office contacted the court and requested hearing on July 5 be changed to plea and sentencing. Clerk advised counsel that time would need to change to 2:15 pm.
Further proceedings on July 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Court grants adjournment request. Matter rescheduled to July 5, 2016 at 1:15 pm.
from Attorney Lieuallen requesting adjournment due to illness.
Further proceedings on June 7, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Perry P Lieuallen in court by authorization. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests adjournment for further proceedings.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 1:15 p.m.

Bail/bond form mailed to Attorney Lieuallen for defendant to sign & return.

Attorney Perry P Lieuallen in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lieuallen waives reading of complaint and pleads not guilty. State requests signature bond with conditions not to operate motor vehicle w/o valid dl. Court sets bail. Attorney Lieuallen requests 48 hours to have defendant sign bail/bond form. Court so grants.  Counsel requests further proceedings date.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
